newsitem.title: CANADA: Bre-X negotiates to resolve Busang dispute.
newsitem.headline: Bre-X negotiates to resolve Busang dispute.

text.p: Lawyers for Bre-X Resources Ltd are negotiating "around the clock" to resolve a dispute with one of the company's Indonesian partners, a Bre-X spokesman said on Thursday.
"The best way to put it is we're sitting down with them to see if they have anything solid," said Steve McAnulty in a phone interview from Calgary.

The Indonesian partner has a 10 percent stake in Busang I, one section of Bre-X's spectacular gold discovery in Indonesia. The partner recently told Bre-X it believes it is entitled to a similar stake in Busang II and Busang III.
While Bre-X said the claims have no merit, the company wants to discuss details with its partner to make sure, McAnulty said.
"We're working diligently around the clock to come to a solution," McAnulty said. "We're confident we'll come to a resolution on this thing in fairly short order."

The company's shares had fallen C$0.95 to C$24.10 in trading of 2.8 million shares by late afternoon after Indonesia's Mines and Energy Ministry told Reuters it would delay issuing a contract of work until the dispute was settled.
Bre-X has applied for a contract of work for the Busang II and Busang III areas covering a huge gold deposit in Kalimantan.
Without the government contract, Bre-X will have trouble advancing its search for a partner to develop the property, analysts said.
"I imagine a lot of potential major partners want to make sure that underlying ownership issues are all resolved," said Chris Bradbrook at Loewen, Ondaatje, McCutcheon.
But Bre-X said the search for a partner will not be hurt by the contract delay.
"We don't consider this a significant thing in our lives," McAnulty said.
The dispute has prompted a re-evaluation of exploration in Indonesia, analyst Jim Taylor at Yorkton Securities said in an interview from London.
"People are concerned there may be other skeletons in the closet in relation to other mineral exploration projects," he said.
Bre-X has said the resource calculation at Busang I stood at about three million ounces of gold. The resource in all three parts of Busang total about 47 million ounces so far.
New resource totals are expected out soon, McAnulty said.
